doc.after: In the late 19th century the European imperial powers engaged in a major territorial scramble and occupied most of the continent creating many colonial territories and leaving only two fully independent states Ethiopia known to Europeans as Abyssinia and Liberia Egypt and Sudan were never formally incorporated into any European colonial empire however after the British occupation of 1882 Egypt was effectively under British administration until 1922
